meanings.definition: A diagram representing the relationships between three or more variables in the form of a graph or chart.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used nomograms to explain how different factors affect each other.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often rely on nomograms to visualize complex data sets.
meanings.sent3: The nomograms at the science fair made the kids giggle with their colorful shapes.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a set of nomograms, connecting ideas in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent5: The nomograms in the textbook made the concept easy to understand.

meanings.definition: A graphical calculating device that represents mathematical relationships in the form of curves or lines.
meanings.sent1: The engineer used nomograms to quickly solve complex equations.
meanings.sent2: Nomograms are commonly used in engineering for their efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The nomograms on the calculator made math class more interesting.
meanings.sent4: Her precision in calculations was like that of a nomogram, always accurate.
meanings.sent5: The nomograms on the computer screen helped visualize the data better.
